subject: Horse Racing
Breeding of Animals
lead_paragraph: Storm Cat, one of the top stallions in thoroughbred racing history, has been retired as a breeder. Ric Waldman, a stallion consultant at Overbrook Farm where the 25-year-old Storm Cat was born and stood at stud, said owners made the decision because of a steep drop in Storm Cat’s fertility rate. Last year he produced 32 mares in foal, compared with 3 this year. Storm Cat, a descendant of Secretariat who for six straight years commanded a $500,000 stud fee, has produced 160 stakes winners who combined to top $112 million. Among his sires are 88 yearlings that sold for more than $1 million.
